answers.answer: Hi - I don't think what you are writing about sounds like Type 1 diabetes.  Is that the diabetes you mean when you say "early onset?" There are many five year olds (my own was one.... ) and kids much younger, babies even, diagnosed with Type 1, so there really is no such thing, unfortunately, as "early onset."  And if did have Type 1 it would progress more quickly than a year's time - it would have gotten to the point where she would be very sick, with very high blood sugar (much higher then 199) within a month or two.  It does sound like something is going on, though - and that maybe it is something associated with her Lyme diagnosis - ?  Have they checked her for celiac?  That can cause stomache pains and weight loss.  Some of her other symptoms do sound scary.  I hope you can find a doctor that can figure it out.  Keep us posted.

question: I'm not sure if I should be posting here b/c my daughter hasn't been dx but I really am trying to find out some info on our problem, so I apologize if I'm in the wrong spot.  My 5 yo old daughter has had abdominal pain for about a year now.  It almost a daily complaint but sometimes it gets so bad she gets very pale,dark circles under her eyes,crying, sweating and then she'll pass out, it can be very hard to wake her.  There has been a couple of times where she did vomitduring these episodes.  She complains of leg pain also and says her eyes are bothering her, she has had eye exams and has 20/20 vision. She has a rash often like a yeast infection that i thought she was getting from not wiping herself well enough but that wasn't the case.  She has accidents w/ wetting her pants ans always seems as if it's urgent when she has to urinate.  She hasn't gained any weight about a year. This all started after she was dx w/ Lyme disease. Lyme was treated w/ amoxicillan(sp?), this was in Sept.of 08 and first "episode" on x-mas of '08,things have been progressevily worse since than.  She has been to a GI doc that ruled so many things and an allergist. She was also treated for abdominal migrains but that wasn't the problem. I came to this board hoping to get some advice, I know you can't dx my daughter but getting some  advice from someone who has personal experiance w/ diabetes.  We have checked her blood glucose before, she had a fasting number of 199, 157 2 hrs after meal and she has been 131 during the night.  I did bring to the ped w/ the 199 but hours after they would see us her number was w/in range. Could she be very early onset diabetes? Could the Lyme disease been a trigger? I've read it can time to develop. She has  doc appt on Friday, should I talk to them more about this?  Thanks for any ino and advice!
title: early onset diabetes
